SENT.plain: We report 3 cases of acrocephalosyndactyly V (Pfeiffer syndrome) in the same family
This syndrome is characterized by coronal craniosynostosis with facial dysmorphism and specific malformations of the extremities (wide stubly adducted thumbs)
The pattern of inheritance in autosomal dominant
The place of this syndrome is discussed in the group of disorders associated with acrocephalopolysyndactyly
